  "DOCTOR: I understand it's sometimes hard to talk about, but could you tell me more exactly how much blood you've been coughing up\u2014would you say it's just a tiny bit, or has it been more than that, and has it been staying the same or getting worse over the past few weeks?",
  "PATIENT: It\u2019s probably just a bit of blood here and there, but at times it seems a little more than just a tiny bit, and honestly, I think it\u2019s been like this for a little while now, maybe a few weeks.",
  "DOCTOR: \"Can you tell me more about how much blood you've been coughing up \u2014 would you say just a little, or sometimes more, and has this been getting a bit worse over the past few weeks?\"",
  "PATIENT: I guess sometimes I see a little blood, and it's maybe happening a bit more now, but I didn\u2019t want to bother anyone or make it seem worse than it is.",
  "DOCTOR: \"I appreciate that talking about blood in your sputum can be sensitive.   "PATIENT: Honestly, I think it\u2019s been a little more than before, but I don\u2019t want to make a big deal out of it. It\u2019s probably nothing, just a bit more blood, I guess.",
  "DOCTOR: \"I understand it can be hard to be completely open, but can you tell me more precisely how much blood you've actually been coughing up\u2014would you say just a tiny amount, or has it been more than that?   "PATIENT: It's probably not that much, maybe a little more than just a tiny bit sometimes, but I haven't really paid attention or kept track. It doesn\u2019t seem to be getting worse or anything.",
  "DOCTOR: \"Can you tell me, in your own words, whether the amount of blood you've been coughing up has been about the same, or if it's been more than before\u2014maybe a little more\u2014and when you notice this change happening?\"",
  "PATIENT: I think it's probably a little more than before, maybe just since last week, but I didn't want to overreact.",
  "DOCTOR: \"I understand it might be hard to talk about, but could you tell me if the amount of blood you've been coughing up has been actually increasing over the past few weeks, just staying the same, or maybe even getting a little better?   "PATIENT: Yeah, I think I've been coughing up a bit more blood the past week or so, and I\u2019ve just been more tired than I usually am. No fevers or night sweats that I\u2019ve noticed, but I guess I\u2019ve had some weight loss too.",
  "DOCTOR: I understand that talking about blood in your sputum can be sensitive. Can you tell me more precisely how much blood you\u2019ve been coughing up\u2014would you say just a tiny amount, or has it been more than that? Over the past few weeks, have you noticed the amount of blood increasing, staying the same, or perhaps even getting less?",
  "PATIENT: It\u2019s probably just a little blood still, not a whole lot, and I guess it\u2019s been the same for a while now. It\u2019s not like I\u2019m coughing up tons or anything.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you had any recent medical tests, like a chest X-ray, CT scan, or bronchoscopy, to look into the cause of the bleeding, and if so, what did the doctors tell you about what they found?",
  "PATIENT: No, they didn't really tell me much, just that they did some tests before, but I don't think they found anything serious or I would've remembered. It's probably nothing.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you had any recent imaging studies like a chest X-ray or CT scan, and if so, what did the doctors tell you about what they saw regarding your lungs or any possible sources of bleeding?",
  "PATIENT: No, I haven't had any scans or tests like that. I just been coughing a lot and losing weight, but I didn't think it was anything serious.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you spoken with your doctor recently about any imaging tests, like a chest X-ray or CT scan, or biopsies, and if so, what did they tell you about what they saw or found in your lungs?",
  "PATIENT: No, I haven't really talked to anyone about scans or anything. Last I heard, nothing serious was found, or I didn't understand it much anyway.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you had any recent scans of your lungs, like a chest X-ray or CT scan, and if so, could you tell me what the doctors saw or found regarding any growths, masses, or unusual findings in your lungs?",
  "PATIENT: I don\u2019t really know if I\u2019ve had any scans lately. If I did, I wasn\u2019t told much, and I thought it was probably nothing. I\u2019ve just been dealing with this for a while now.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me if you've had any recent chest X-ray, CT scan, or other imaging tests done to look at your lungs, and if so, what the doctors told you about what they saw or found?",
  "PATIENT: No, I haven't had any scans or X-rays or anything like that, so I don't really know what they saw if they did any.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you recently had any scans like a chest X-ray or CT scan to check your lungs, and if so, can you tell me what your doctor told you about what they saw or found during those tests?",
  "PATIENT: No, I haven't had any scans or anything like that. No one told me about any results or findings, so I just figured everything was probably fine.",
  "DOCTOR: Can you tell me in your own words what the doctors saw or found when they looked at your lungs on your recent chest X-ray or CT scan, if you remember?",
  "PATIENT: They just said something about the lungs looking a bit different, like maybe an infection or something, but I don\u2019t remember all the details. I guess it\u2019s not great, but I thought it was probably nothing serious.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you spoken with your doctor about what they saw or found on your recent chest X-ray or CT scan?",
  "PATIENT: I haven't really talked to anyone about the details, and I guess I just wanted to check if it's something I should worry about or not."
